channel.title: Easy question for someone who is good with scar
channel.description: Hey i was thinking i could use scar for a FPS game as an aimbot cause it a color picker. But i was wondering what the string would be to make it go to the color when it sees an oppenent. O and just to let u guys know i used to play runescape for a long time so that how i know about scar. Thanks guys any help appreciated.

item.title: Easy question for someone who is good with scar
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

That is what I suspected. Anyone else confirm this? What game(s) did you test it on, jukka?

Read full topic

item.title: Easy question for someone who is good with scar
item.dc:creator: @jukka jukka
item.description:
@jukka wrote:

I have tested this it doesent work. It does how ever find the color (tested in CSS colored models (Red)) But since the “Mouse” is locked in the middle of the screen. It simply starts to spin rapidly around.

Read full topic
item.source: Easy question for someone who is good with scar

item.title: Easy question for someone who is good with scar
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

del_signo:

you might have a better chance if you didn’t have it on full screen and the lowest possible graphics also try editing the textures .you can make the enemy head bright pink other then that i would say its nearly impossible

It would make it easier, but whether or not it’s on full screen, it still hijacks the mouse, right?

Read full topic
item.source: Easy question for someone who is good with scar

item.title: Easy question for someone who is good with scar
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

chris101:

Hey i was thinking i could use scar for a FPS game as an aimbot cause it a color picker. But i was wondering what the string would be to make it go to the color when it sees an oppenent. O and just to let u guys know i used to play runescape for a long time so that how i know about scar. Thanks guys any help appreciated.

I assume it’s a full-screen game with the cursor/crosshairs firmly planted in the center of the screen? I’m not exactly sure how that would work, because they usually have a wider variety of colors, more anti-aliasing (which creates colors that shouldn’t be there), and a mouse that can’t simply move to an x/y coordinate.

Read full topic
item.source: Easy question for someone who is good with scar
